Soal Bahaya Dewan Pengawas KPK, LBH: Jebakan Politik Orang Baik
04 Nov 2019, 09:46 by M Rosseno Aji, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi berencana menunjuk Dewan Pengawas KPK. Juru Bicara Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi, Fadjroel Rachman, mengatakan presiden masih belum memutuskan siapa saja yang bakal mengisi posisi itu.
Menurut dia, masih ada waktu bagi presiden untuk menjaring tokoh-tokoh yang sesuai. "Waktunya masih cukup panjang, (sampai) bulan Desember. Namun proses ke arah sana sedang disiapkan." Fadjroel menyampaikannya melalui pesan teks kepada Tempo, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Permasalahannya, sejumlah kalangan termasuk KPK melihat keberadaan dewan tersebut bakal melemahkan lembaga antikorupsi ini.
Juru bicara KPK Febri Diansyah mengatakan tak mempermasalahkan penunjukan langsung anggota Dewan Pengawas oleh Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi. Sebab, kata dia, hal tersebut sudah sesuai dengan Undang-undang Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 tentang Komisi Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (UU KPK).
"Persoalan bukan pada kriteria, tapi ada beberapa problem di UU tersebut yang berisiko pelemahan," kata dia, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Febri mengatakan KPK telah menganalisa UU hasil revisi. Hasilnya ditemukan ada 26 poin perubahan yang berpotensi melemahkan KPK. Salah satu hal yang dianggap melemahkan KPK yakni keberadaan Dewan Pengawas itu sendiri.
Tim transisi yang dibentuk KPK menilai Dewan Pengawas lebih berkuasa daripada Pimpinan KPK. Namun syarat menjadi Dewan Pengawas malah lebih enteng ketimbang menjadi pimpinan.
Pimpinan KPK diharuskan, berijazah sarjana hukum atau sarjana lain yang memiliki keahlian dan pengalaman paling sedikit 15 tahun dalam bidang hukum, ekonomi, keuangan atau perbankan. Syarat itu tak ada untuk dewan pengawas.
Selain itu, kewenangan dewan juga masuk pada teknis penanganan perkara. Mereka berwenang memberikan izin tertulis untuk penyadapan, penggeledahan, hingga penyitaan meskipun tidak berstatus sebagai penegak hukum. Pertentangan ini rawan dipersoalkan di praperadilan.
Integritas Dewan Pengawas juga hal lain yang disorot tim transisi. Tidak seperti pimpinan KPK, anggota dewan pengawas tidak dilarang untuk bertemu dengan pihak-pihak yang tengah berperkara di KPK.
Dewan Pengawas juga tidak dilarang untuk rangkap jabatan, bahkan untuk menjadi komisaris, direksi atau pengurus yayasan tertentu. Hal ini menurut tim berpotensi menimbulkan konflik kepentingan.
Sekretaris Jenderal Transparency International Indonesia Dadang Trisasongko menilai kode etik Dewan Pengawas dibuat lemah karena dewan ini dibentuk untuk membuka pintu intervensi politik ke KPK. Ia khawatir KPK tak lagi independen karena keberadaan dewan ini. “Ini penjinakan KPK,” ujarnya.
Direktur Pusat Kajian Konstitusi Feri Amsari mengatakan pemilihan Anggota Dewan Pengawas yang memiliki integritas sebenarnya bisa meminimalisir dampak kerusakan yang ditimbulkan oleh keberadaan Dewan Pengawas. Namun, ia pesimistis Jokowi bakal melakukan itu.
Sebab, menurut dia, Jokowi adalah salah satu yang memotori pelemahan KPK lewat revisi Undang-undang Nomor 30 Tahun 2001 tentang Komisi Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi 9UU KPK). Ia menduga Jokowi akan menempatkan orang-orang yang dapat mengakomodasi agendanya untuk menjadi dewan pengawas. “Saya tidak akan terlalu percaya pada pernyataan dari istana,” kata dia.
Ketua Umum Yayasan Lembaga Bantuan Hukum Indonesia Asfinawati menganggap siapapun yang akan dipilih menjadi Dewan Pengawas akibatnya akan sama buruk bagi KPK. Sebab, menurut UU KPK yang baru, posisi Dewan Pengawas lebih berkuasa dari komisioner, sementara aturan kode etiknya lebih lemah dan mekanisme pemilihannya dilakukan dengan lebih sederhana.
“Kita jangan terjebak dengan politik orang baik yang melihat posisi di tata negara sebagai orang, ini adalah sistem. Jadi siapapun yang dipilih sebagai dewan pengawas, dia sudah di bawah cengkeraman presiden,” kata Asfinawati.

Problem on the Danger of the KPK Supervisory Board, LBH: Political Traps of Good People
04 Nov 2019, 09:46 by M Rosseno Aji, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo or Jokowi plans to appoint the KPK Supervisory Board. Presidential Spokesman Joko Widodo or Jokowi, Fadjroel Rachman, said the president had not yet decided who would fill the position.
According to him, there is still time for the president to capture the appropriate figures. "The time is still long enough, (until) December. But the process in that direction is being prepared." Fadjroel conveyed it via text message to Tempo, Monday, November 4, 2019.
The problem is, a number of groups including the KPK see the existence of the council will weaken this anti-corruption institution.
KPK spokesman Febri Diansyah said there was no problem with the direct appointment of members of the Supervisory Board by President Joko Widodo or Jokowi. Because, he said, this was in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2019 concerning the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK Law).
"The problem is not the criteria, but there are some problems in the law that risk weakening," he said, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Febri said the KPK had analyzed the revised Act. The result was found there were 26 points of change that could potentially weaken the KPK. One of the things considered to weaken the KPK is the existence of the Supervisory Board itself.
The transition team formed by the KPK considers the Supervisory Board to be more powerful than the KPK leadership. However, the requirements to become a Supervisory Board are even easier than being a leader.
KPK leaders are required to have a legal degree or other degree with expertise and experience of at least 15 years in the fields of law, economics, finance or banking. There are no conditions for the supervisory board.
In addition, the authority of the board also falls on the technical handling of the case. They have the authority to give written permission for wiretapping, search and seizure, even though they are not law enforcers. This conflict is prone to be questioned in pretrial.
The integrity of the Supervisory Board is also another thing that is highlighted by the transition team. Unlike the leadership of the KPK, members of the supervisory board are not prohibited from meeting with parties who are litigating at the KPK.
The Supervisory Board is also not forbidden to hold concurrent positions, even to become a commissioner, director or administrator of certain foundations. This according to the team has the potential to cause conflicts of interest.
Secretary General of Transparency International Indonesia Dadang Trisasongko assessed the Supervisory Board's code of ethics was made weak because this council was formed to open the door to political intervention to the KPK. He was worried that the KPK would no longer be independent because of the existence of this council. "This is taming the KPK," he said.
Director of the Constitutional Review Center Feri Amsari said the selection of Members of the Supervisory Board who had integrity could actually minimize the impact of damage caused by the existence of the Supervisory Board. However, he was pessimistic Jokowi would do that.
Because, according to him, Jokowi was the one who was driving the weakening of the KPK through the revision of Law Number 30 of 2001 concerning the Corruption Eradication Commission 9UU KPK). He suspects Jokowi will put people who can accommodate his agenda to become a supervisory board. "I will not believe too much in the statement from the palace," he said.
Chairperson of the Indonesian Legal Aid Foundation Asfinawati considers that anyone who will be elected to the Supervisory Board will consequently be equally bad for the KPK. Because, according to the new KPK Law, the position of the Supervisory Board is more powerful than commissioners, while the code of ethics is weaker and the selection mechanism is simpler.
"We should not be trapped by the politics of good people who see positions in the state administration as people, this is a system. So whoever is chosen as the supervisory board, he is already under the clutches of the president, "said Asfinawati.
